summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing travel approval and logistics for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It references prior travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY)
persons.context: Coordinates travel arrangements, including hotel and flight bookings, for the investigation team's trip to Stockholm.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team for trips to Stockholm, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on the travel approval request email for the Stockholm trip.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on multiple travel approval request emails for trips related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Alleyne reports to Tyrrell for travel approval and coordinates logistics based on his authorization.
Both are SDNY staff; Duncan is copied on Tyrrell's travel approval emails.
Both are SDNY staff involved in the Epstein investigation travel logistics.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The SDNY investigation team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Epstein (case 2018R01618) was active internationally, with travel planned for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, in January 2020.
The investigation involved multiple prior trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019.
Travel logistics required approval for expenses over per diem, such as the Sheraton Stockholm Hotel, indicating the urgency or specific needs of the investigation.
The email chain shows a pattern of formal travel approval requests referencing the same Epstein case number for consistency.
Several email addresses and names of SDNY staff are partially redacted or obscured in the text, indicating the involvement of additional team members.
